exampleSentences.phonetic: ทำ-ไม มัน หฺนัก จัง เลย

exampleSentences.thaiSentenceSpaced: ทำไม มัน หนัก จังเลย

meanings.meaning: he ; she ; him ; her (using มัน to mean he/she is regarded as being insulting, unless used by close friends)
(a marker used after a noun or pronoun to emphasize it as the subject of the sentence)
[to be] serious ; severe (of a problem, illness or condition)
so much ; extremely ; greatly (จังเลย is more commonly used by female speakers than males.)

exampleSentences.engSentence: Did you work too hard there ?
exampleSentences.phonetic: คุน ทำ งาน ที่ นั่น หฺนัก ไป หฺรือ เปฺล่า
exampleSentences.thaiSentence: คุณทำงานที่นั่นหนักไปหรือเปล่า
exampleSentences.thaiSentenceSpaced: คุณ ทำงาน ที่นั่น หนัก ไป หรือเปล่า

meanings.meaning: [to be] serious ; severe (of a problem, illness or condition)
to ; off ; away ; into ; in (The translation of ไป in this context depends on the primary verb, but it frequently has no direct equivalent in English and so may be untranslatable.)

words.phonetic: หฺรือ เปฺล่า

exampleSentences.phonetic: โท่ เอ้ย · หฺนัก ช มัด เลย
exampleSentences.thaiSentence: โธ่เอ้ย หนักชมัดเลย
exampleSentences.thaiSentenceSpaced: โธ่ เอ้ย  ·  หนัก ช มัด เลย

meanings.meaning: [to be] serious ; severe (of a problem, illness or condition)
chor chaang (ช - the tenth letter of the Thai alphabet)

(เลย is very commonly used as an intensifier in Thai, but can be difficult to translate directly into English. If it appears in combinations with abverbs such as มาก or จัง, which themselves serve to add emphasis to the sentence, then there's little need for a direct translation. If not, then a translation of "completely" or "totally" can work, or it might evade a direct translation and require a re-wording in English. In a negative sense, a ไม่....เลย combination can be translated as "not....at all" into English.)

exampleSentences.phonetic: คุน ตัว หฺนัก จัง

exampleSentences.thaiSentenceSpaced: คุณ ตัว หนัก จัง

meanings.meaning: body ; physique (ตัว is a classifier every type of animal, all pieces of clothing (except ones that come in pairs, but including trousers), chairs, tables and other pieces of furniture, letters and numbers of the alphabet, and also functions as a general purpose classifier for things and objects.)
[to be] serious ; severe (of a problem, illness or condition)
